content.question: Which of the following caused the British government to establish a Supreme Court of the United Kingdom in 2009 ?

choices.label: It was determined that a permanent legal body be established with jurisdiction to resolve disputes relating to devolution in Northern Ireland, Scotland, and Wales.
British citizens believed that the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) was not adequately strong.
The House of Lords no longer wanted any legal authority because they saw it as an impediment to democratic development.
British citizens supported the theory of parliamentary sovereignty, trusting judges more than Parliament.

content.answer: It was determined that a permanent legal body be established with jurisdiction to resolve disputes relating to devolution in Northern Ireland, Scotland, and Wales.
